apps.graph
Class TopVisitor<T>

java.lang.Object
  apps.graph.Visitor<T>
      apps.graph.TopVisitor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of vertex objects.
public class TopVisitor<T>
extends Visitor<T>

This class implements a specialized visitor that is used for toplogical sorting of a directed acyclic graph (DAG). It subclasses the Visitor class and overrides the action() method to label a vertex with its topological number.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

Constructor Detail

TopVisitor

public TopVisitor(int[] topSequence)
Initializes this visitor with an array to hold topological sequence generated. If a vertex v has topnum i, then topSequence[i] = v.

Parameters:
topSequence - Array to hold topological sequence.

action

public void action(int vertex)
Description copied from class: Visitor
Performs an action at a given vertex, to be called when the vertex is visited. This implementation prints the vertex information, but does nothing else. Subclasses may override this method to add desired special features.

Overrides:
action in class Visitor<T>
Parameters:
vertex - Vertex number of vertex for which action is to be performed.
